title: Elementary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Geography, History and Citizenship Education (2009)
subject: Social Sciences

4A8E5C1E2423414297BAC4B10CACAFC0.description: characteristics of the territory (e.g. relief, climate, bodies of water, resources)

7A38990F2B4A4DE4B61D0E711FC929BB.description: economic activity (e.g. development and processing of resources, services)

877E79E4474541E59AA2723F642EB0C1.description: means of transportation and transportation routes (e.g. car, train, airplane, roads, highways)

9C41F1A59F954BEFB2ADEC0CB94364EE.description: Indicates differences between his/her environment and an unfamiliar environment:

4F59E7454FC14395B17E04A97C5D12B3.description: Knowledge related to the diversity of societies and their territories

6096A1F1D42A43BF864DD8EAA50A812C.description: Names changes in means of transportation and transportation routes (e.g. car, train, airplane, roads, highways)

2D21F19A36A24EB3B85C69030BD8EB7F.description: Names changes in economic activities (e.g. agriculture, industry)

A142ED3DF50C49158993B737D3B6BE51.description: Names changes in everyday objects (e.g. toys, CDs, iron, computer, bicycle)

8D9F6A26360F42F4A7639207F4841E65.description: Knowledge related to change in a society and its territory

F178F8DCA156446C9C7233F4AEBEC982.description: Names events in his/her life and that of friends and family (e.g. birth, first day of school, move, parents’ births, death of a friend or relative)

6BD4B9FD4B0C4C60A68E1BD4488B9F02.description: Describes the roles of different members of the groups he/she belongs to (e.g. the teacher transmits knowledge, the captain of my team encourages us)

5DED02AE772F489285436A4C6D9A2E03.description: Names people in his/her environment (e.g. father, friend, teacher, coach)

A8D196F6B59E4CF0A3913DF89801ED09.description: Names natural resources (e.g. forest, water, fertile soil, minerals)

112F73802039499082C7D998E07A322E.description: Names bodies of water (e.g. river, lake)

DE1DE3B58C694E5794EEFE6149030BDE.description: Names elements of climate (e.g. precipitation, temperature)

9E1F972E2EC14C99BF845160455C7618.description: Names types of relief (e.g. plain, valley, plateau, hill, mountain chain)

64D3C15B2DFE451BA1225ACD9F90193B.description: Indicates rules of order for groups he/she belongs to (e.g. in class students must raise their hand before they speak)

526C8EB3AB81422BB99227752B5DB482.description: Names institutions (e.g. city hall, municipal council)

DEEED4D31A5148728A99644645CE8E77.description: Names means of transportation and transportation routes (e.g. car, train, airplane; highway, road, railway)

D21DC0073E864553AFF5FD7A11463C43.description: Names needs satisfied by economic activities (e.g. food, entertainment)

AB55781EDFE249CCA15F3C3C3306310A.description: Names elements of the landscape related to economic activities (e.g. farm, factory, bank, port)

E7FD49CFD83B417FB623BBFF30EA8AAC.description: Names everyday objects (e.g. toys, CDs, iron, computer, bicycle, car)

8D2DD5FD94B0410C85910E85E8799AAE.description: Names the religion(s) practised in his/her environment (e.g. Catholicism, Protestantism)

50725535812D4C12A5C1DC127F60A28B.description: Names the language(s) spoken in his/her environment (e.g. French, English, Italian)

98E7DEEF373C4D8B83A511C9E888A0AE.description: Indicates the number of members in the groups he/she belongs to (e.g. there are 10 players on my soccer team, there are 24 students in my class)

92FFCE5E0E2941ECA0A4A9A64F09089B.description: Describes the composition of the groups he/she belongs to (e.g. my soccer team is made up of boys and girls and an adult: the coach; my class is made up of boys and girls and an adult: the teacher)

0D3A5EFC42DC428DA48E283A902F113F.description: Names groups he/she belongs to (e.g. family, friends, sports teams, class)

76203D12FC6B4F53B78BF7AF59A0C499.description: Indicates activities associated with different ages (e.g. children go to school, adults can drive)

5E76BDF634E547AABA6DA29D74EA9071.description: Indicates physical traits characteristic of different ages (e.g. a baby has no teeth, grandparents sometimes have white hair)

9D8498214EF14A3AB9E5502B6A3554C0.description: Situates events in his/her life and that of friends and family on a graduated time line (e.g. my birth, my first day of school, a trip, my parents’ births, the death of a friend or relative)

8AF54C8ED45C4B8BB6DB1B49E1D41B4D.description: Orients himself/herself in time: calendar, day, month, year

2DD4C22F46DD4800901888385F2DCB15.description: Orients himself/herself in space using the points of the compass (e.g. my house is south of the lake, my swing is west of the tree)

79A72A7D95604CBFB2CE81E8D28D76F6.description: Orients himself/herself in space, a simple drawing, an illustration or a scale model (e.g. my bicycle is in front of the garage, my swing is to the left of the tree, the post office is north of the playground)

850F2F40B88A4E70AA5315108A1A6787.description: Knowledge related to the organization of a society in its territory
